Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: drdanielmacdonald
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a platinum member on a great BOGOF rate over 4 nights...the fantastic Veronica checked us in and told me of the perks.20% off bar/restaurant, free wifi and a great room with 2 doubles in it. Good aircon as well.... A small and perfectly square pool up on the roof. Will always return

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jornkristian
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location close to Santiago Bernabeau, several shops and restaurants. The nearby metro station will also take you downtown in five minutes. The reception and lobby were big and very nice, there were even two restaurants and a bar. There was also a spa, but it was very expensive so we did not try it. The rooft top pool was also a nice touch. We were staying in a king size room with a seperate dining area which were nice, with two TVs and a sofa. The bed was very big and comfortable. The aircondition however was noisy and gave us a cold the first night. Our only big complaint about this hotel is the expensive breakfast which is not included, even in the more expensive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: totbi2100
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with clean basic rooms. pool on the top roof and small fitness. next to santiago bernabeu, however quite far from city center - 10 EUR in a taxi. Rate without breakfast is very reasonable. Plenty of places to eat close to. No free WIFI in the rooms. Average standard for a four star.

Reviews.Title: “room was fine, bathroom poorly designed”
Reviews.Author: maptreker
Reviews.Content: We spend our last night at The Holiday Inn Madrid before flying back to the US. The room was simple in its design and furnishings. it was also very clean. Bed was comfortable but the toilet in the bathroom was placed very close to the wall with a shelf next to it. Im not over weight and in order for me to sit comfortably I had to lift my arm and rest my elbow on the shelf with the shelf under my arm pit. The the toilet paper roll was up under the shelf. It was the most uncomfortable bathroom I had ever used. I couldn't imagine staying in the room for any length of time with the toilet in this position. For one night it was tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Across santiago bernabeu stadium”
Reviews.Author: KikoX
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel overall, excelent location in front of santiago bernabeu stadium and just steps to metro station, walk to main madrid atractions, a nice area to eat, shop and walk, staff is excelent and price is right. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dulin38
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn for two nights on a business trip to Madrid. The location was perfect for me, just around the corner from the office building I had to go to. It is a bit far off the city centre for anyone just visiting for leisure who wants to explore Madrid's sights. The hotel can easily be reached via subway, as it is located at the linea 8 that goes straight to the airport. The rooms are quite big and comfortable, a choice of pillows is available, breakfast can be ordered to the room without any extra room service charge, WiFi works brilliantly. The hotel also has a small gym with steppers, treadmills, a rowing machine and some weights. It has a rooftop pool that was closed when I stayed there (a bit weird, as it was already June). Overall, I was very happy and comfortable in the hotel and would choose it again!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LLM_12
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel, as are all Holiday Inns. The restaurant was very quiet, the menu wasn't very big.

Reviews.Title: “Most convenient stay for Real Madrid fans !”
Reviews.Author: Follow_myAdvice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only 400m from Santiago Bernabéu stadium ! so no worries for metro with "Santiago Bernabéu" stop or "Nuevos Ministerios" stop, the later reachable directly from the airport, line 8. For dinner, and night activities, it's not the best spot in town, but you will still have some choice of tapas and bars, in case you feel lazy and don't want to go to city center. The personnel was friendly ok, speaking english no problem. Check-in/check-out super fast; computer in the lobby available and printer too for your boarding pass. The room was very confortable, slept very well, not noisy. The bathroom was with full bath, and very clean. I was however disapointed by the gym/sauna (swimming access closed during the stay), don't bother going there, also because there is a proper "Holiday Gym" fitness center next to it. I did not try the buffet breakfast in the restaurant, 22€ !: no thanks; just go to the bar and have juice/coffee/croissant for 6! (or cheaper in the commercial center 2mn behind). As a conclusion, it's a good hotel (business/family) but with a little lack of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base For Exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: andym1954
Reviews.Content: I last stayed here around 9 years ago and it hasnt changed too much. It is covenient for the metro with the Santiago Bernabeu station just 5 minutes walk away but if you are feeling more energetic there is a nice flat walk along Paseo de Castellana into the centre. On this walk you pass a number of squares with fountains and statues. Check in was quite quick but check out not so much. Our room was large with a good sized bathroom. We were booked in on a room only basis so declined to pay an extra €22 each for breakfast. We did have one evening meal in the hotel which was reasonably priced and quite enjoyable. Unfortunately the roof top pool wasnt open as it was out of season and nether of us wanted to use the small gym.

Reviews.Title: “Everything seems correct here, therefore it feels a bit dull...”
Reviews.Author: LucianMM
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay at this hotel. This time it was on business purposes. The price is correct, the cleanliness, the endowments, the service, everything seems to be where it supposed to be from shower gel to staff attitude. I have no complaints, it's just that it doesn't give you that homy feeling you could get even in some chain hotels. It serves very well the business purpose though, especially if you have no time to focus on other things. The location is perfect for business as well, since is closed to the Nuevos Ministerios area and Plaza de la Castellana, with many of the big business towers in Madrid. It is less than 10 minutes and 10 Euros by taxi from Palacio Real and Puerta del Sol in case you want to go downtown for the tourist landmarks. Barajas Airport is only 20 min away by taxi. There is wifi internet in any room but is not quite broadband speed as advertised. At 11 Eur/ 24 hours the value for money is not great, especially if you're used to really high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for thew price”
Reviews.Author: Gimena B
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for a quick trip in and out of Madrid, but the place on the outside gives a bad impression. It is not upkept and it is a ways from the main street so you actually can miss it. The surrounding area isn't bad but not attractive. The rooms are okay. The staff is friendly and accommodating though.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the cost for comfort!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsIngleby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Took metro from airport to hotel. Nearest stn Santiago Bernabeu. Simple and only 2.5euro - taxi about 30euros. 2 double beds in comfortable room clean room.First kettle did not work. Asked for another and came instantly with extra supplies of tea/milk, View not up to much, but only for one night. Ask for room at back of hotel - away from main road. Breakfast appears to be expensive 22e but compared to light breakfasts at bars you can take your time and eat a vast array of food from continental to full English. Reception staff overworked, but all speak English. Opposite Madrid football stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have to attend a Congress or a Real football game”
Reviews.Author: BarakTheDoc
Reviews.Content: I never saw an hotel wit such awkward entrance: narrow, four steps or a slippy inclined path and a very modest sign. Actually at least one taxi driver didn't know how to reach it. Once inside its the typical Holiday Inn - not more but also not less

Reviews.Title: “Here for business, would not stay for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cherylhinton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times as our Spanish office is up the road. The staff are always lovely and friendly and welcome you to the hotel. However as business traveller, one of the most important factors is a good nights sleep. I have never had one here, this time I could hear the man moving around his room next door so well, he could have been in my room. Being a lady traveller thinking a man is in your room really does not make for a good nights sleep, especially when he coughs and wakes you up! The decor is tired, so is the room but it is clean and the beds are comfortable. I like the choice of pillows. I have got the metro around the city easily and you can get from the airport here for 2€ which is a bargain. Some good places to eat nearby, ask the hotel as you wouldn't find them otherwise. Breakfast is pretty good with plenty of choice. Batman is very pleasant and provides nice nibbles. I will return again for work as it is so convenient, however I would not stay here for pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, location could imporve, fair internet”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: I mostly liked the rich breakfast. The hotel is located in a less touristic area, but it's just 3 minutes walk from Metro line 10. They recently added wireless internet and my room had poor signal so I could not connect. Staff was very helpful as they tried to move the access point closer and when this didn't prove to help - they changed my room, which solved the problem. However, I did have to spend some 2 hours handling this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room with sitting room and dining table”
Reviews.Author: titter-ye-not
Reviews.Content: Being a member of priority club I was upgraded to 539 - own sitting room seperate from bedroom, 2 TVs, settee chair, writing desk etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain, stay here and enjoy your time”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: This place is just great. The staff treat everyone like family and the services are just great. Everything works fine, no broken showers or anything. The location is outstanding and worth every penny peak season or not. You have all the modern amenities and the wifi is very fast. I stumbled back and lost my key like a dozen times a day and they didn't care. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A nice familiar base when in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HeightsRunner
Reviews.Content: In Madrid on business at the IFEMA convention center and the Holiday Inn Madrid was worth the metro ride each day. Located within walking distance to great restaurants and shopping and right near the metro and many bus lines the Holiday Inn was a great base. The rooms are large by European standards and very clean and well kept. The staff were all very helpful with great suggestions on local restaurants and shops. The bar gives you an hour of free wifi with purchase - just enough to check email and stay up to date without ridiculous charges. Breakfast is fresh with something for everyone - my only wish is that it would open earlier. Many people are here on business and a 7am start is a little late. All and all much happier here than my co-workers staying out by the convention center!! Thank you Holiday Inn, Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable, lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lawstudent01
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights on a work trip recently. The location is just around the corner from the Palacio de Congress and the football stadium that is home to Real Madrid. I had a room facing the rear of the hotel. It was very quiet; the room was large and comfortable, with a good quality of furnishings and fittings. The location was convenient for me and it is near to metro stations, shops and restaurants. It was easy to catch a taxi outside the hotel. The breakfast buffet was extensive and good quality. Internet was my one bugbear - both expensive, and only accessible for either an hour or a 24 hour period, which meant daily trips to the front desk to obtain another 24 hour access code. It was not possible to set it up at the beginning of my stay so that I could use it for the duration of my stay. However the front desk staff were helpful and knowledgeable and with excellent spoken English. The front facade of the hotel is exceptionally ugly (a festival in concrete) but it is set well back from the street which means it feels quite peaceful, quiet and safe. My colleagues liked using the gym. A very good and convenient business hotel, apart from the wifi access.

Reviews.Title: “tribute to honest staff”
Reviews.Author: jadecot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week (October) on a conference. I would like to pay tribute to the honest chambermaid (Patrica?) and her housekeeper Soledad Fernandes and front of staff Hortensio Domingues who returned $160 left behind in a plastic wallet in the safe, and my phone charger. Nice to know some people are honest !

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: linmikga
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Holiday Inn Madrid after an overnight flight from New York. The room was unremarkable, but a big plus was that we were able to check in at 9:30 am without additional charge. We had prepaid our reservation. As platinum with HI the only perk offered was free wifi. It was only a couple of blocks from several metro stations and getting around Madrid from this location was relatively easy. Altough we would have no problem staying here again if in Madrid, we would probably look at other options as well before making a decision.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for business locations but somewhat soulless”
Reviews.Author: Alastair F
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with the hotel as such - the bar is fine- the restaurant is quite servicable (but breakfast clearly aims at those who just always have a hotel breakfast - there are places around at a quarter of the price). I stay here reasonably frequently, but it just lacks character. If you are doing business in the neighbourhood it's very handy - if you like Real Madrid it's very handy (the stadium is a few minutes walk and the tour is fun). Azca though (the concrete jungle around it) is fine at ground level, but below ground can seem to get very seedy. I'll undoubtedly stay there again - because it's very handy for the business that I do in Madrid, but I won't eat the breakfast unless I get a good exclusive rate. No great views, and this time, to be fair, I was very close to the lifts and hardly noticed them (which means the sound insulation isn't too bad). Handy for the centre of Madrid on the Metro, and no great distance from the airport either by metro or cab. It's not the best, it's not the worst, I guess that if I were paying my own money I'd probably resent the rates...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for 2 adults+2 children”
Reviews.Author: SandraBarreiros
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for 2 adults with 2 children for good value. Very close to metro station and to train station to San Martin de La Vega (Warner Bros theme park). Breakfast to expensive (21€/ person/ day) which was no problem since it is a Starbucks just in front of the hotel. A lot of restaurants nearby to lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel that met expectations - but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: JPar5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Santiago Bernabeu stop on the 10 line. We found the hotel very acceptable and it was exactly what we expected, but just that. The rooms were clean and suited its purpose. Some small annoyances: we were not given robes and slippers as promised, they did not clean and/or replace the cups the second night, the water boiler (for the coffee) was very rusty and the staff at the reservation could not help us with reservations that was outside of Madrid (as we were going to Barcelona afterwards). Overall, I got what I paid for. The location, as mentioned below, is somewhat far from city center, but then again, you get what you paid for. However, it wasn't too inconvenient as it is very close to the metro and there are connections all over the 10 line. There is a starbucks and TGIF across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: edfromvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go to the nearby Real Madrid soccer stadium. You are a 10 minute walk away---well, 60 minutes away when there is a crowd of people. Pretty nice hotel room. Comfortable for 2 adults and 2 kids. Pool is small and unheated though. Breakfast (20Euros/pp) was too rich for our blood. Location is not ideal for the more touristy spots but has good access to the airport metro and, like I said, the stadium. If you are going to the stadium, this is really the ONLY SMART choice. (Metros and taxis would be a poor option because of the crowds.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: IqbalNoor
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has an excellent location. Maybe 3-4 minutes from metro and buses. Starbucks and TGIF right in front. And of course the Real Madrid stadium is about 7-10 minutes across the road!!! A number of breakfast and eating places within a stone's throw (breakfast at the hotel was Euro 20+!!, we chose to go for stone's throw), plus window shopping opportunities all around. It is quiet in the evenings, lots of families were staying while we were there. The hotel staff were very very nice, patient and knowledgeable. The rooms are comfortable though the hotel furnishing isn't great shakes but if you are more focused on sightseeing or business, you don't mind the furnishing. In any case they do have tea/coffee making facilities - which we found to be nonexistent elsewhere in Spain. All in all a great place to stay for 3-4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mastermc54
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid for this hotel, I was very satisfied. I flew into Madrid from Newark and was happy to be able to relax here for 2 nights. The hotel is not in a busy area, but it's easily accessible to the metro and all the hot spots/touristy areas are a few stops away. As a Priority Club Platinum member, I was given free wifi access, 2 bottles of water per day, and a welcome basket of fruit from the manager. The rooms are a bit dated, but clean and fairly comfortable. The lobby area looks amazingly clean and newly renovated. The staff was friendly throughout my stay. The only negative is that I had emailed the front desk asking to print out several pages for me and some of them were missing. When I inquired about them, the front desk didn't seem to know about it although I had called the night before to let them know I needed some travel confirmations to be printed. Otherwise, this was a great stay in a peaceful area of Madrid. It may be hectic on days when Real Madrid is playing since the soccer stadium is a few minutes walk away. There is a mall nearby and right across the way from the hotel, you'll find a Starbucks, TGI Fridays (overpriced in my opinion), and an Italian restaurant (didn't eat there).

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way but easy to get into the action”
Reviews.Author: Vanessaaussie
Reviews.Content: We booked the HI Madrid for 4 nights before we left on a Best of Spain tour with Trafalgar. I had read some horror reviews which we found to be totally unfounded. We found the reception staff extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and although alittle dated very comfortable. The room staff were lovely with nothing being too much trouble. The hotel is about a 10 minute taxi ride from the Puerto del sol which we walked one day which was a fairly leisurely down hill took about 45 minutes. There are numerous eateries within easy walking distance of the hotel with a vast array of tapas and very good ale cart menus. We were very happy here and would definitely recommend to others to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quite and clean, can get your work done here, excellent for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Rickee_Ricardo
Reviews.Content: Central location, easy access to taxi's at the hotel or across the street, shopping nearby in case you forgot something (like a tie). Metro station is a couple of blocks away so you can use that too. Room had nice table where you can work, WiFi access is fast, was able to send/receive large files without a problem. Breakfast buffet is good, they have everything to get your day started. Room was always clean, not noisy, minibar was stocked daily and even had a power connector adapter available in case you forgot yours. Defenitely a good place to stay at for a business trip if you need to work and prepare for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, until you check out: they add 8% tax to your bill!”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: It looks like a nice hotel. They do have serious problems with their reservation system - checking in and out takes forever. The area is a bit boring - everything is closed on Sundays. It's a business district. The rooms look like they were updated, PC members are allowed to take a bottle of water per day. They gym has everything one needs - crosstrainers, tredmills and a weight machine. When you check out though, the bill doesn't seem what I thought it would be: they add 8 percent tax. I stayed in another HI (Express) near the airport and no taxes were added - i paid 65 Euros including bkfst! Almost half of what you pay for this Holiday Inn Madrid hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service near Bernabeu”
Reviews.Author: MuirtonPark
Reviews.Content: As a first-time visitor to this hotel, I was surprised it rated only average in the reviews. Maybe it has been upgraded, but the room was large, clean and well furnished, the bar was comfortable and the front-desk service could not have been more friendly and efficient. As a regular visitor to Real Madrid's stadium - a very short walk away - I shall definitely try this hotel first in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lyonnaisdecoeur
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Euro HI - nothing spectacular, but definitely a good value in Madrid. It's not in the best area for tourism, but it's right near the Bernabeu metro and has easy access to both the airport and the city centre. Rooms don't have the new refurbishments that most of the other HI's do but they're decent enough. For the price it's worth it. I like the easy access to the airport for a morning flight. I've stayed at some of the other HIX's in Madrid and they're not as connected to the airport via metro, so you'll have to spend 20 euro+ on a taxi to get there. The hotel also upgrades well for PC Platinum

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, exceptional service - perfectly close to Real Madrid FC!”
Reviews.Author: LondonOaf
Reviews.Content: You know what you're getting with the Holiday Inn - okay it's basic and no frills, but at the same time it's also comfy,good value for money, clean and welcoming. The staff at this hotel were also exceptional, providing excellent customer service too. The location is not the most central, but you're only a hop away from town in a cab. You are also conviniently close to the Real Madrid FC stadium which is well worth a visit. Definitely recommend for a fleeting visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is what makes this hotel worth it”
Reviews.Author: SYRAQQQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business on two nights, with a night in another city in between. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you have a great stay. Veronica, in particular, was extremely helpful, as she made sure that the guests that I was hosting in Madrid had nice rooms and were taken care of. She also recommended some great places to eat and tour. The rooms themselves were on the small side, but that is what you expect in Europe. The location was on the north side of town, which is OK, as the Subway is closeby and if you were to taxi to the tourist spots, its no more than 8-10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Real Madrid match and IFEMA Expo”
Reviews.Author: englaender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I was an at expo at IFEMA expo centre. Its ideal for this, as its only 20 mins on the metro, with one simple change of lines. Takes the same in taxi as does in Metro, but far cheaper on metro. Hotel itself is average. Walls very thin, and catering not great. The gym looks ok on photos, but although it has 2 good running machines, the rest is of awful standard. With mismatching dumbbells and other weights. Despite there being 2 great private gyms next door, the hotel doesnt have a deal with them. Rather disappointing. So - great for expo and Real Madrid matches... very very average for everything else. And misleading gym. And 20 euro for breakfast?!?!? - theres a Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: daniv45
Reviews.Content: I'm visiting Madrid very frequently for business meetings and the Holiday Inn Madrid become almost a second home and home base for business for me and my colleagues. The hotel is not fancy but was recently remodelated and is very comfortable and convenient. Good and rich breakfast. The staff is very attent and their service excellent. The location is not very close to the tourist center of Madrid (but 15 minuts Taxi away from it) which is an advantage for business traveler, that needs a quite place at evenings. Nevertheless, it is located one block from the Real Madrid Stadium (the Bernabeu) which is a tourist attraction anyway and a spot of interest when bringing customers from abroad to visit. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Madrid”
Reviews.Author: pamilasari
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night after coming from Barcelona but this hotel exceeded expections.\nThe front desk was especially helpful with a problem that had followed us from Barcelona. \nWe lost our money at the hands of a pick pocket at the Barcelona Train station. The hotel staff even called a cab that accepted credit card that we used for the airport ride. “Very good for business travelers and not bad for leisure ones. Waiters in the bar were extremely kind. There's a taxi stand in front of the hotel and a wealth of shops and places to eat something very near. If someone is a Real Madrid fan (I'm not), their stadium is just at the back of the hotel. ”

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Metro and lys to do in...”
Reviews.Author: thorndyke
Reviews.Content: Good location near Metro and lys to do in the area. Don't miss La Tagliatella restaurant almost next door. Huge entered and delicious. Same goes for the salads. Big enough for two. Dinner for two with beers €35.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for our family of travellers”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTatonka
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel that started off our Spain 2010 trip where we planned to travel throughout much of Spain. When we arrived from the airport after the trans-Atlantic flight, the beds were very comfortable and the windows could be drawn so that we were all able to have a cat nap. The location was great for us as we had some soccer fans in the family and walked to the Bernabeu a number of times. It was also in a spot that made for very quick travel throughout Madrid by bus (no need to hop on the metro). We were warned by the taxi driver about walking in the area at night as there is a reputation for pick-pocketers but this is more specific to the stadium area and on game days. We travelled out and around the hotel without any concerns or issues and had breakfast and some dinners at the German restaurant right in front of the hotel. The pool was small but the kids were thrilled to be swimming at the very top of the building and it made for a great view as well as a great way to cap off long, tiresome days filled with walking. This hotel made for a great welcome to a city that we all grew to love and felt comfortable and safe travelling in!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel, not bad for tourist stuff either”
Reviews.Author: Monk-san
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I was bowled over by this hotel, but it was OK for what I wanted and I will go back there the next time I need to work in Madrid; if only because I can see the office from the front of the hotel, so it's super convenient for me. After work I stayed on for the weekend and my husband flew out to join me. I wouldn't choose it as a location for the tourist part of the city, but as I was already there it wasn't too bad for the old town and therefore easier to stay put than to check out and relocate for the last two nights. GOOD STUFF The rooms were a nice size - I got to try two different rooms and they were both good. The corner rooms are biggest. Beds are very comfortable. The bathroom was a reasonable size, there was good power on the shower and also a decent hairdryer. Each room includes a kettle with some coffee, tea and UHT milk. There is space in the fridge "For guests", which is handy. (I know you can just move the minibar stuff out of you want to use the fridge, but I appreciated the touch of making space ready for my own-bought drink). The rooftop pool is marvellous. It may not be huge, but is was never crowded when I went there and the cool water is such a win in the summer heat. The decking is nice and there are shady and sunny spaces available. You can pick up towels from the gym as you walk through it on your way to the roof. The gym equipment was reasonable - two running machines, two cross trainers, two bikes (One upright, one sit back), a rowing machine, free weights and one of the pulley-weight things. Lots of mirrors, which make it feel more spacious, towels and chilled water. There are a couple of tellys and I usually found it fairly empty meaning that I could turn the telly off and just listen to my own MP3. It's just a couple of minute's walk to the Metro and a short journey to the old town, so you can easily enjoy the best parts of Madrid after a day at work. The Metro is EUR1 each way, and if you really can't be bothered with it, a taxi is only EUR10 each way. NOT SO GOOD STUFF The gym doesn't seem to have aircon. The control is there, but it won't switch on and that is no joke in the midsummer heat. Especially when there is a fantastic gym on the ground floor, with dozens of machines and called "Holiday Gym". It's branded like it comes with the hotel, but they are pretty quick to tell you that you can't use it. There are no in-room safes from floor 4 downwards, so I recommend that you request a higher floor. They didn't tell me that this was the case when I checked in, but when I commented to my colleague, who had come over from Munich, that I was fed up with lugging all my valuables around, she said that her room had a safe and so I requested a change. That was when reception admitted that the lower floors had no safes. They seemed almost surprised that I wanted to change rooms to get a safe, but since they clearly state in their book that they won't accept liability for stuff left in your room, I don't see why they would think that I should take a punt. I moved to floor 8, which I liked because I could easily take the stairs to the gym on floor 9 or the pool on floor 10. The staff weren't terribly helpful. Normally anywhere with free wi-fi asks you if you want the code when you check in. The next morning when I realised I didn't have the log in code, I asked for it at reception and was informed that it wasn't free and she mentioned a fee of (I think) EUR6 per hour. That's more then I'm prepared to pay for a measly hour - it's cheaper to use my data roaming, despite my phone company being rip off merchants. Plus there is free wi-fi all over Madrid - on the Metro for a start - so why should I pay for it at my hotel? I have already paid business rates to be there. I did hear someone else being told by a different receptionist that you got an hour's free wi-fi a day, but by that time I'd located the hot spots and couldn't be a...d with their reception anymore. The rooms keys seem to fail regularly. To start with they said that my card was fine and that it was a problem with the room lock. When I changed rooms, I had the same problem, which they assured me was a result of my having a mobile phone (Surely everyone has a mobile phone?!) My husband joined me for the weekend and once we had two cards, we found that one worked and one didn't (despite being kept together), so I think that the problem was with the cards and I don't know why they kept saying that it wasn't. When I spoke to reception about mine, they always re-set it and it always worked afterwards. Overall, they certainly weren't rude, but they also weren't welcoming or actively helpful, and this was a noticeable contrast to my last business trip to a Radisson hotel (in another city) where they went out of their way to be helpful and plesant. I don't think its a cultural thing either, since my colleagues in the Madrid office couldn't have been nicer. IMHO when you travel on business, it is often in antisocial hours (e.g. I arrived at the hotel at 1.am knowing I had to meet my colleague 7am the same day), you are often on your own and just want the hotel experience to be easy. I have visited 6 different countries so far this year and with the best will in the world, I can't speak the local language everywhere I go. I don't need to be given a hard time by the reception staff if I can't muster up much more than "hola" at 1 in the morning. (Sorry sidetracking a bit there!) The decor is pretty tired and there was a small patch of mould on the shower curtain in my second room (I hate shower curtains - you just know that they never get cleaned!). Apparently all HI hotels are being renovated, so maybe they will put air-con in the gym, fit safes in all the rooms and replace the wallpaper, which is dangerously close to anaglypta! They only give you one towel per person, like no-one ever washes their hair and body at the same time. I took extra towels back from the gym to redress this. They don't provide a flannel either. I also used the gym water supply to top up my water bottle, since water from the mini bar was Eur4.50. 4.50!! And yet you can buy a litre for Eur3 from room service - bizarre. I ordered a burger from room service and it wasn't very nice. That'll teach me to choose junk food! Breakfast is EUR20, which in fairness to them is typical for city hotels, but still a complete rip off if you just want something light to start the day - it's never an option to pay EUR2 for a coffee and a croissant (or similar), despite the fact that this is exactly what it will cost you if you walk to a cafe such as Jamon Jamon, about 2 minutes away from the Holiday Inn (Its on the gound floor of the building with "Allianz" on the roof. As a regular business traveller I wasn't very impressed with this hotel, but the roof-top pool just about swung it for me so in view of the convenience, I will go back. With more welcoming staff, air con in the gym and a bit of makeover it could be excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Biyani
Reviews.Content: My family enjoyed our one night stay in this hotel. Very nicely located hotel with all the amenities. The bathroom was neat. The service level was world class. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants peace and quiet, in smart clean surroundings with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A place to rest your weary head.”
Reviews.Author: SnoopD4ve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a recent city break to Madrid. As a member of the Intercontinental Hotels Group Priority Club, it was a no-brainer to stay here as for 4 nights, I only had to shell out 107 Euros along with some of my Priority Club points. The hotel is situated in the northern part of the city, close to the Santiago Bernabau football stadium, in what can best be described as a commercial area. The hotel is within a couple of minutes walk of a Metro Station, and it's only a couple of Metro stops back into the main city centre attractions. The Metro is cheap and easy to use, so getting to and from the hotel is a breeze. Later at night, when the Metro is either closed or you want to see the city at night from above ground, taxis are cheap and plentiful. From the city centre to the hotel only takes 10 minutes and will cost you less than 10 Euros. Reception was friendly and efficient, and on arrival we were upgraded to a "suite" without asking. Our suite was clean and functional, but was a bit tired looking. This is probably a reflection of the age of the hotel - it really does need a bit of a make-over. That being said, for a city break my wife and I didn't spend any amount of time in the hotel - Madrid has such a lot to see and experience, there really is no need for a "resort" hotel in such a great city. Our deal excluded breakfast, and as it's fairly expensive in the hotel, we resorted to using a local bar (20 metres from the hotel) and cafes within the adjacent shopping centre. Breakfast can be had at these places for a fraction of the price of the hotel breakfast, although I'm sure the hotel has a greater choice. The location of the hotel isn't obvious when you leave the Metro station, but walk west on the main road from the football stadium and look up - you can't miss the green Holiday Inn sign on the roof of the hotel. Overall, convenient and cost-effective option for a Madrid city break.

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget, But Works”
Reviews.Author: Dianha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Madrid recently, and I can't say that I was disappointed by anything in particular. The front desk staff wasn't overly friendly (except for Luis), but they were efficient and knowledgeable. I'm not mad at that. The room I stayed in was clean, and housekeeping made a concerted effort everyday to come in and tidy up, replace towels, etc. The only thing that I found bizarre was that there wasn't a clock anywhere to be found. To check the time, I had to keep changing the television channel. Not exactly catastrophic, just annoying. While we're on the subject of television... Do not expect to find any channels in English. Every single one -- including CNN! -- ran Spanish-language programming. I kind of got a kick out of watching Spongebob Squarepants (or, rather Bob Esponja) speak Spanish, but it definitely got old after a while. This was actually the first time I'd been overseas and couldn't find at least one channel in English. Not sure what that's about... The "fitness center" offers the bare minimum in the way of exercise equipment. Luckily, there was never really anyone else in there with me, so I didn't have to wait for any machine. The food was fine, as were the drinks, but I couldn't understand why ordering drinks through room service was cheaper than getting them at the bar. Since no one delivering my orders spoke English, there was no way for me to ask. One thing that got under my skin was the staff's insistence that I charge everything (food, drinks, Internet fees, etc) to my room. They kept saying that it was "easier" for them when I didn't use cash. If someone can explain that one to me, please do. All in all, I had a great time. The hotel is in a great location, with a mall right in the same plaza. Also, if you need anything -- and I mean anything at all -- a trip to El Corte Ingles will solve your problem (it's right around the corner). It's a combination Wal-Mart/Saks Fifth Avenue/ShopRite/Best Buy/souvenir shop, and it's huge! They sell everything from motorcycles to patio furniture to high-end designers to food. I was definitely impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beb111
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be adequate and comfortable. It is close to the Metro, a mall, and the football stadium. It is definitely not in the middle of Madrid, but very accessible. The rooms are on the small side but comfortable. Unfortunately, during our stay, there were some kids on our floor who were just too loud and seemed to be partying way after midnight. These happened two nights in a row and some guests were really upset and banging their doors for them to keep it down. The hotel has a bar in the lobby where patrons can smoke. This made the entire lobby very smoky in the evenings. If you are allergic to smoke, this may not be a good hotel for you. Also, the staff could use a little more smile and be more accomodating. They were not rude, but they did not seem happy to provide service. Overall, we had a decent stay but will probably not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable bed/beddings plus A/C was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: cindyandted
Reviews.Content: The positives for us were the comfortable beds and pillows. Each bed had two hard pillows and two softer ones. All were nice sizes. The a/c worked extremely well which made for a great night of sleep. The bathroom was fine. Towels were better than a Hilton that I regularly stay at. The reception staff were okay. A smile would be nice. Noisy kids in room down the hall until after 10 PM. Other parents and kids in hall who were noisy as well. Parents need to get a handle on their kids. This is getting worse as the years go by. I could have called the front desk and requested they silence these people but I thought surely four year olds would be alseep by 9. Not the fault of the hotel. The location is only good if you need to be in the financial area or if you are going to the stadium. Nothing much open on a Sunday. We asked the front desk if there was a supermarket open or restaurant and their answer was "everything is closed." This just isn't true. There is a small market across the avenue which is open until 2 a.m. and an italian restaurant just around the corner from the HI. The room gets a 4. The staff a 3. Location 2 if you are the average tourist. You will pay for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Servicable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: pdxmark2
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I were recommended to stay in this hotel based on its location near to our company offices. In my experience, Holiday Inn hotels outside the US have a better image and are slightly nicer than they are in the US, so we took the recommendation. We ended up staying three nights in the hotel, Friday-Saturday-Sunday -- so we stayed there while having some free time to do sightseeing as well as while we started working. The location, near the Paseo del Castellana, puts it walking distance from the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu, home of Real Madrid. No matches that weekend, but I can imagine it would make the local metro station (Santiago Bernabeu) pretty busy. The area surrounding the hotel is sort of a business district, but turns residential, too. Seemed like there were plenty of small, decent restaurants within a few blocks. The metro station is a 2-3 minute walk from the main entrance to the hotel, so that was convenient, too. The staff was friendly and efficient. They were able to recommend restaurants and give directions and we consulted them multiple times. The check in and check out processes were quick and efficient. The hotel itself was decent. The lobby, lobby bar, and breakfast restaurant were nice (although the breakfast buffet was a whopping 20 Euro for a standard European hotel breakfast buffet). The three elevators were good and fast -- felt like I didn't really ever have to wait for them. The sleeping room seemed pretty spartan to me. Compared to the lobby and hallways, seemed rather dated and worn. There's no high-speed internet line to the room. The wireless worked okay, though (was 11 Euro for 24 hours). It was reasonably comfortable and clean, but not luxurious. Overall, it felt like sort of a 3-star room in a four-star hotel. Small exercise room with a few pieces of equipment, however there were two gyms in the same block, one right outside the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Football”
Reviews.Author: dreamsnatcha
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just minutes away from the world famous Bernabau stadium home to one of the greatest teams in the world. Yes Real Madrid....... Need i say more. ok ok well other than that I've stayed here over ten times in the last five years when i go to Madrid its top of the list. Minutes to get checked in by the staff who are always eager to sort out your every need. The Hotel is mainly used by business travelers it has a small pool and gym on the top floor. must be honest I've never eaten there mainly because Madrid has everything and at lot is close at hand. There are some cool bars and restaurants just round the corner, a massive corte ingles shopping center plenty of tapas bars and the metro is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: owenmillions
Reviews.Content: Were upgraded to suite which was very kind of them .Well located ,Cant fault it .Breakfast expensive £18 so brought food in !

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel...nothing more...”
Reviews.Author: Eldik
Reviews.Content: I usually prefer to stay in Holiday Inn chain hotels but this is the first time that I will rather not coming back to this hotel. It is not that it is a bad hotel but it is simply not the same standard that I am used to when I go to one of the chain hotels. The building is old and the rooms are a bit old fashioned (even when I was upgraded to the executive floor). I read some complaints before about hearing everything from the walls… well I didn’t have a problem with that but I can understand what they were talking about. As for the location… it is not my cup of tea… It is in the city but in a “grayish” area where you can find restaurant and shops but it simply looks a bit out of date… can’t really explain it… I think that this hotel needs a serious touch up and then it would worth coming back. Another annoying issue is the price that they charge, about 170 euro - Definitely overcharged. I stayed in much more classy hotels then this one for less… Bottom line… an OK hotel… I would go there only if you need the points for your priority club membership, but if it is not an issue for you… better find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable safe bet for Mdrid”
Reviews.Author: BarBarYPartRIdGe
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is a comfortable hotel located near the Santigo Bernabeu stadium. It is a clean quite hotel with courteous staff. Serves a good selection of food for breakfast and easy to get around from.

Reviews.Title: “Agree, good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: sealion2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Madrid Holiday Inn in May of 2009. We were in Madrid for a vacation and stayed 6 nights at the hotel. It is very clean and the service is excellent. I highly commend the front desk staff for excellent English, willingness to help and give information. It is "not close" to the downtown and tourist attractions. Pubic transportation is excellent in Madid and safe. Bus 27 takes you from near the hotel, the stop is about a block away, to the Prado. Metro #10 takes you to the Puerto del Sol. Both are reliable and cheap. If you take the local train from the airport to the Nuevo Ministeries Stop, either take the metro on to to the next stop at the hotel, or just invest in a short cab ride. I do not recommend the walk to the hotel with luggage. Several American style fast food restaurants are close to the hotel, McDonalds and Burger King for example. Try the Ristoranti La Tagliatella in the evening, it opens at 8:30 PM for great pizza and pasta. It is practically next door. A Corte Ingles is within walking distance and has a great supermarket and deli in the basement. Rooms are much bigger than most hotel rooms in Europe and up-to-date. You even get a kettle to make hot tea and coffee. That is not found in many hotels in Spain. Recommend the hotel inspite of the few drawbacks. The walls are little thin and it is not close to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: wicketo
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers worn rooms in an old building. It is true the walls are paper thin, but that doesn't bother me. Everything is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpfull. The hotel is a fair bit from the center but well connected by bus and metro. Getting to and from the airport also easy by (inexpensive) public transport. Didn't eat at the hotel, as options in Madrid are fantastic, well priced and plentyful. Got a very good rate - especially for madrid where mid range quality and pricing is hard to find - and for the money we paid the hotel was definately above average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service , Great Place !!”
Reviews.Author: SKW001
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Madrid and I always come back to this hotel. The staff is superb, rooms are large and clean, breakfast is very well served. As an example, I needed to iron a shirt urgently at 7pm, a lady kindly took it and it was back in 20 minutes as a courtesy service, what else can you ask for ? Maybe it's not in the best location for tourists, but public transport is very close and there's always a taxi waiting. I truly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: nick365
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in the last four months, service excellent, staff always very helpful. Out of the main centre next to the Santiago Bernebeau stadium and metro station, but easy to jump on the metro and go into town, 10 ticket metro an easy way to get about and cost effective. quick ride from the sirport on the metro all in all very convenient. All the facilities and extras a business hotel should have and good for a leaisure trip

Reviews.Title: “Priceless !! A quiet room in one of the very few quiet areas of Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Pinky_and_Brain
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Madrid is THE place to be if you are struggling to find a quiet area to sleep at night without complaints about outside noise. Madrid is a very noisy city 24 hours a day, almost anywhere you stay.....and you'll be hard pressed to find other quiet alternatives elsewhere in the city, with the same excellent transport connections as this hotel, LOCATION: -Do not let the non-central location of this hotel put you off.....rather than being a negative aspect it is actually the best thing about this place ! - Located between towers "Torre Europa" by Plaza de Lima and "Torre Picasso" in the north part of Madrid, this is a predominantly business, governmental & residential area of the city. The most amazing thing is that this area is mostly quiet day AND night. For Madrid, that is a rare thing ! -Staying here you will be away from the city centre and most tourist sites but you can reach all of these within 10 minutes by metro (underground, subway). The hotel is a 1 to 3 min walk to "Nuevos Ministerios" metro station and to the "Santiago Bernabeu" metro station (line 10, dark blue colour). The metro is modern, efficient and will take you anywhere you want (Prado museum, King's palace, main train and bus stations) in no time at all. The metro runs till 1.30 past midnight. -The "Nuevos Ministerios" station has 3 metro lines passing through it...line 10, line 6 and most importantly line 8 which connects directly to Barajas airport. Due to this good link a lot of airline staff (flight attendants and pilots) use this hotel. -Hotel is also close to: Santiago Bernabéu football (soccer) stadium (home of Real Madrid) Large branch of "El Corte Ingles" shopping complex Residential area near "Calle de Orense" street with shops, ATM's (cash machines) & restaurants. Try the Argentine restaurant near "Torre Picasso" Spanish governmental ministries of Economy, Science and Defence and others "Palacio de Congresos y Exposiciones" Bus lines going into the city ROOM: -Clean and modern in the usual holiday inn standard decor. Good size for European expectations. Room was warm in winter. The full length 70's style triangle shaped windows can give you a bit of vertigo if you are on a high floor. -Bathroom was also sufficient in size. Included a bidet and bathtub.... but the shower curtain should be a no-no in a 4 star hotel There was a slight sewage smell from the bathroom which was fixed after we complained. -Free "Economist" magazine in room and free newspapers at reception and gym -Each evening the hotel staff left a small card on the bed with the next day's weather forecast....I thought this was a really nice and interesting touch. EXTERIOR & COMMON AREAS: -The holiday Inn Madrid is a huge, grey, concrete, odd-shaped, 1970's dinosaur of a building. Don't worry as inside the hotel everything is very modern, clean and in good working order. -There is a rooftop pool which is open in warm times of the year (but not in winter)....great for getting some sun, rest and relaxation. -Fitness area has limited choice of equipment, 2 small saunas (one for men and the other for women) and a very small hot-tub (Jacuzzi, whirlpool). Apart from the fact that it was too small for more than 3 or 4 people sitting closely together, the paint coating in the whirlpool was coming off. -The lobby has a bar which serves reasonably priced cocktails... STAFF: -Mostly helpful and friendly BREAKFAST: -Check if your booking includes breakfast....ours didn't and the hotel wanted a whopping 22 Euro per person to eat at the buffet....we gave it a miss...Go to the cafes downtown or get the bargain "menu del dia" lunch deals in town for around 10 Euro (usually includes drink and dessert in the price). INTERNET ACCESS: Business centre with a few computers in the lobby...but you have to pay high prices... OVERALL PRICE: We paid 69 Euro a night without breakfast, which compared to other hotels in Madrid, is an absolute bargain, especially considering the fact that a quiet night's sleep is priceless in this city ! PROBLEMS: -Don't pay too much to get an executive room...there's not much that differs from the normal rooms. -The hotel itself and its entrance can be hard to find the first time you arrive (despite the hotel building being huge)...this is because it is covered by other tall buildings. When leaving the metro station head for the exits marked "AZCA" or "Torre Europa". The hotel entrance is in a small square just off "Avenida del General Peron". Look for an entrance to an underground garage. -I have never been at this hotel during a football (soccer) match at the nearby stadium....I wonder if it will still be as quiet, after a game.... -As a another reviewer mentioned...I wouldn't walk after nightfall through the high rise office blocks near "Torre Picasso" as a shortcut to get to the "Nuevos Ministerios" metro station....take the long way round. In the daylight hours it's fine to take the shortcut. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- GENERAL TIPS ABOUT MADRID -Almost ALL hotels in Spain always will ask you to see, but not keep, your passport, identity card or driving license. (and often, but not always, anyone else staying in the room with you) -Many retailers in Spain will ask you for your passport, identity card or driving license if you pay for something with a debit or credit card. However, I managed just with a photocopy of my passport so keep this mind if you don't want to risk losing your ID by having it with you all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good enought”
Reviews.Author: Vilmute
Reviews.Content: The hotel and service is o.k., just location is more for business travelers, but not for tourists, because it's quite far from the center.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent and convenient, like at Home...”
Reviews.Author: daniv45
Reviews.Content: For a frequent traveler like me, visiting Madrid almost every 2 weeks during the year in average for business, the Holiday Inn Madrid has become like a second home. I was in much fancier hotels, but this one is convenient, warm and clean, comfortable rooms of the right size to feel at home. The rooms have the necessary furniture, WiFi coverage and appliances to be able to work comfortably at night after the buiness meetings. The hotel team and service are excellent and welcoming. Rich breakfast in the morning and plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood. Located in a strategic location in Madrid near the Paseo de la Castellana, clam at night and not in the hectic and noisy area of the old city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Uzairkai
Reviews.Content: The hotel I guess is in an average area. The business center really isn't a business center at all - 3 computers, 1 printer and 2 phones... The hotel overall was fine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, prompt Service”
Reviews.Author: tarekhammoud
Reviews.Content: This hotel in fantastically placed next to the Benrabeo Stadium, very close to the metro and bus connection to (2 to 3 minutes walk). The lobby is slick, and rooms offered me exactly what I needed: - Confort - Calm - Space Breakfast was great too: excellent choice of hot and cold items... what a better way to kick start the day ;)

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RudyVerhaegen
Reviews.Content: I come to Madrid since many years for business purposes. After initially trying a wide selection of different hotels, I felt most comfortable with this Holiday Inn and since then I chose it always for my business trips. The rooms are very comfortable, modern and are maintained to the highest standards (e.g. flatscreen tv's, wireless in all rooms, perfect matresses, etc.). I'm particularly careful on cleanliness of bathrooms, and never ever found another guests' hair in sink or on the floor. Staff is very always very helpfull and friendly, mostly multilingual, and no effort is too big to help you in any possible way. And if you have a Priority Club Card they make your feel 'an honoured guest'. Breakfast buffet is more then you can ever need or want to eat and evening restaurant is good quality for price. Another bonus on this hotel is the outdoors swimming pool on the roof of the hotel. As Madrid had some 7 months of 'swimming pool weather', it is a pleasant treat after a days work. Location is perfect for as well business purposes as leasure (Bernabeu stadium and Metro at 200 meter) . Also it is close to Madrid's biggest shopping centre (Corte Ingles) where you literally find everything. Plenty of excellent (as well small as fancy) restaurants in a radius of 500 meter around the hotel. Since a year there is also a direct Metro line from Barajas airport which ends at 500 meter from the hotel. So for me no other nor better choice then this Holiday Inn when i'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights in February to sightsee in Madrid. At first, I was hesistant to book this hotel because it is not in the downtown. However, when I found out that subway stop is only 2 min walk away, I booked because price was much much lower than at hotels in downtown. This hotel is close to sports stadium. If you time your trip correctly, you might be able to see Real Madrid play socker game. Getting to downtown is very easy and takes about 20 min. I tried subway as well as bus. Just get pass for public transportation and hop on and off buses and trains as needed. There are at least 2 bus lines going to downtown from hotel. We didn't have to wait longer than 15 min. Subway appeared to be more frequent and faster. There was one almost every 5 min. Unlike in the States, there were vending machine on platforms. You could buy sodas and candy while waiting. Subway in Madrid is also the cleanest subway I've ever seen. Very clean, new and safe (comparing it to NYC, Washington DC, London, Paris, Prague, Philadelphia). Hotel also feels new. It is more fancy than the usual Holiday Inn in America. I'm a Priority Club member, so I usually stay at Holiday Inns. The staff at the front desk was bilingual and spoke fluent English. Check in was easy, service above average. Lobby was very upscale - marble, stainless steel, great flower arragments, expensive furniture. Room was good size and looked new. It was very clean and so was the bathroom. It had all the amenities as usual, including pay-per-view movies in English. I didn't try restaurant but business center was good and free. Definitely recommend to stay here. It's a great value and it is easy and cheap to get to historic center.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business place in the summer”
Reviews.Author: garbus222
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently for 2 weeks (while being on business) and very much enjoyed it. Location in the business area - that's true. But Santiago Bernabeu Stadium is just 5min walking from the hotel. Hotel itself (building) and rooms - nothing special. Quite good overall. Clean, good service. TV a bit messed up, but ok. Now, the best part is the swimming pool in the summer. On the top floor (10th) there is a swimming pool open in the summer from 9am till 9pm. EXCELLENT! I came white to Madrid, left looking like latino ;-). Every day after office swim suit and hoop onto the sun bed. FANTASTIC! There is also sauna and jacuzzi and reasonable gym. Facilities ok. Overall - very good business choice.

Reviews.Title: “Average location”
Reviews.Author: Suitdude32
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Holiday Inn, I guess, reasonable standards all round, with nothing spectacular. Definitely not a tourist-friendly location, being in the financial district of Madrid, far removed from the cultural heart. In fact, I found the surroundings downright depressing, as the buildings were clearly constructed in the late 70's and early 80's, and the surrounding streets felt a little unsafe, although there was no problem walking around, fortunately. Public transportation available by either Metro or bus, but when you're on holiday, and time is at a premium, the last thing you want is to travel further than necessary - well, for me anyway. Perfect if you're a soccer fan, as the Santiago Bernabeu stadium (home of the Real Madrid team) is right opposite, and sells Real Madrid merchandise. Lousy gym - poor selection of equipment. Would recommend tourists to choose hotels in the downtown area, e.g. Salamanca, Gran Via or Retiro.

Reviews.Title: “A relief!”
Reviews.Author: suziegg
Reviews.Content: After bailing out of yet another sub standard hotel, we booked into the Holiday Inn. Whilst it is nothing too brilliant, the rooms were clean, the bed quite reasonable and the service pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “OK.. but what one would think of a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: dcl80
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel is old and run down, but the rooms were nice. Small but nice for a HI. The location is not the best.. but is right around a Metro to get you downtown. Would I stay here again.. no.. I think this is a good value for family's but is lacking what I like in a hotel. I booked an executive room, on the web is states free mini bar, but when you get there it is only one drink and candy bar a day. So not all that..

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gracian88
Reviews.Content: Due to a good experience in two very reliable Holiday Inn's in a recent trip to France, I decided to choose Holiday Inn this time for a weekend in Madrid. The hotel building is in a big office complex made in the 1980's and 90's. The rooms are big, and although a bit old-fashioned, extremly well mantained. The staff is friendly and ready to help. They were also prone to share the old tradition of conversation as good people from Madrid, of course, in Spanish. Moreover, I think they have been very effectively briefed. The hotel is very near the Castellana, the big avenue that crosses Madrid from North to South. The hotel is about 5 Km. (3 Miles) North from Museo del Prado, for example. There are lots of buses that go along this avenue. You can pay cash, provided you have change. The bus is nicer than the subway, as you can enjoy the avenue at all its length. I imagine, however, that it can be a bit inconvenient on raining days. I would warmly recommend to avoid crossing the office complex during the night, for security reasons. This is easy, because the hotel is situated in the perimeter of the complex. There is no problem during the day. Breakfast is excellent, really above average.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gremlin82
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 day mini break for the family and had an excellent experience at this hotel. Situated to the north of the city it is 300 metres from the Metro (excellent system) and the same distance from the Santiago Bernebeu (the home of Real Madrid) which is well worth a tour, even if you don't really follow football. Were upgraded to a junior suite without asking, giving us more space for the kids. Room was clean and well equipped, couldn't fault it except for some minor noise from the lifts. Unfortunately, we were the victims of a pickpocket (in common with many others in Madrid) but the reception staff could not have been more helpful in sorting out the practicalities. Area surrounding hotel is more business than tourist but still has interest for families and trip into centre (Sol) takes only about 15 mins. Metro tourist tickets are remarkably cheap. Breakfast buffet was fantastic, didn't eat in the hotel otherwise. You won't go hungry in Madrid so long as you can wait until about 9pm for your evening meal as nothing happens before then.

Reviews.Title: “Great but”
Reviews.Author: Needyouradvice
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel that was booked with our tour. The location is great albeit not exactly where all the action is. For me, it was good enough because there were plenty of things within walking distance and you can easily get around Madrid via metro, bus or taxi from this location. The hotel is clean, quiet and adequate. However, I did find that service is sometimes an issue. Directions to things were difficult to get. Everything is within 10 minutes per the Spaniards even if its 100 miles :). Ice is another concept the Europeans have trouble with. Don't expect free ice.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!”
Reviews.Author: Kazzy68
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was in a good location, just a few minutes from the centre and the staff were friendly and helpful. Would not have liked to stay in a central hotel as I believe it would have been too noisy to sleep at night Our twin room was a good size, with larger than single beds which were very comfortable and good tea/coffee making facilities. I would not recommend eating in the hotel restaurant, the food was okay, but very limited choice and seemed quite pricey for what you got. There are plenty of local restaurants that are more reasonably priced. However, they make up for it with breakfast - what can I say but WOW!!! I have never seen choice like it from pastries, pancakes, fruit & fresh fruit salad which was big chunks of fruit, meats, cheeses, biscuits & crackers, yoghurts, fried breakfast and I could go on and on and on......... The gym was handy for anyone wanting to keep up with their fitness and not busy. Finally the best bit of all for me was the rooftop pool. After a long day sightseeing it is great to go and chill out in the sun by the pool. Being on the roof, you do not lose the sun until about 9pm so great for sun worshippers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nickyormonde
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a lovely 3 night break at the Holiday Inn. Our main reason for visiting Madrid was to visit the Real Madrid stadium which is literally 5 minutes up the road from the hotel and well worth a visit. I am not a football fan myself but even I enjoyed the tour! Plenty of good shops nearby - we found lots of places to eat. Spent a few hours by the pool on the roof and soaked up some sun. Lovely jacuzzi and sauna even if a bit small. A great hotel - with easy access to the metro. Easy to get to from the airport. All in all - a wonderful place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and excellant location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stay here on business for 5 nights. Found the hotel to be in a great location near the Bernabau Stadium. Breakfast was excellant. Great choice of fruits, continental + hot foods and lots of pastries/pancakes. Room service was very prompt, no more than 20 minutes after ordering. My hotel room was on the 8th floor. Views weren't great but the room was very well proportioned with a double bed and a large sofa. Bathroom was fine, with a bath and overhead shower. Room was very quiet even with AC on full blast. The gym in the hotel was a medium size with basic equipment (2 treadmills, rowing machine, 2 x cycles, free weight and 2 x weight machine and an abs area). The gym included a separate male and female sauna. Swimming pool was on the roof (didn't use) and a small jacuzzi also). There is also a private full spec gym called Holiday Gym (not part of the hotel). I assume there would be a fee to use but I did not check. Eating out - the metro is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Right and right again takes you to Stadium Bernabau and Left and left takes you to Ministereos station. 10 minutes to Gran Via/Sol. Euro 1 each way. Moda Shopping centre (Right and right out of the hotel) is behind the hotel with several reasonable shops in my opinion (United Colours of Benetton, Naf Naf, Accessorise and Etam are some well known brands). There is also a nice Italian restaurant with great food. Other shops nearby (straight and left out of the hotel) include El Corte Ingles and H&M. Would definately stay here agin. Very nice hotel and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: GAPD4
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four night stay at Holiday Inn Madrid, and had a good all round experience. Twin room very clean with good size beds, coffeee making facility and choice of pillows. Did not experience any noise at night, only slight clicking from AC which can sound like someone is trying to enter the room, but it is not enough to prevent sleep. Breakfast was brilliant. Lots of choice, including pancakes, large chunks of a variety of fresh fruit, cereal, breads and pastries, eggs and bacon with fresh juice (not the fake concentrated stuff) Had a meal at the restaurant one night, food was ok, not enough choice on the menu and would recommend using local restaurants instead. Rooftop pool, sauna and whirlpool were a very welcome oasis after sight seeing all day. Pool is cold on first hit, but lovely once you are in. Location was good for us (two ladies sight seeing), far enough away from the noise of the city, but close enough that city is very accessible either by Metro, or tourist bus which we used. Also short metro ride from Barajas Airport. Would recommend this hotel, found staff very friendly and helpful !!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn... Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: MaryK7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just completed an organised tour of Spain and stayed at the Holiday Inn on my husbands Priority Club rewards points. We got a deluxe room with two double beds (only needed one!), complimentary wine, bottled water and fruit. It was heavenly! The cleaning of the room was excellent, it was always spotlessly clean. Decor was modern and the bathroom was new. We ordered room service one night and the food was excellent and delivered promptly. Likewise the service at the front desk was always helpful (and they didn't mind speaking English after our pathetic attempts in Spanish). The only problem came when we checked out and they tried to charge us for the room and didn't seem to understand about the Priority Club rewards booking. That was sorted out quickly, however. I agree with the previous reviewers - the location appears to be near the CBD and not really near the historic centre of town. But the metro is a short 10 min walk away. Tip - laundry at the hotel is *very* expensive ie 5 euro per shirt. We discovered at the end of our stay a laundromat two blocks down on the street Commondant Zorita. In Sydney at the Holiday Inn Potts Point, they have a washing room with a coin operated dryer and washer. I wish that other Holiday Inn hotels would adopt this idea. Internet is also very expensive at HI Madrid so find somewhere else to check that. But if you have your own laptop, wireless access is gratis. Overall, a great stay, we really enjoyed our time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip”
Reviews.Author: lockyHanoi
Reviews.Content: I just spent almost 7 nights in this hotel and my stay was a mixture of good with some bad. Good Points: The hotel has a good location close to stores, restaurants and the famous Madrid Metro (the best way to get around the city). The room was a nice size and was generally kept clean and I had no problem with any traffic noise. Not so good: - The tub bathroom always lossing water, even after repairing i left some water running to keep the water level for a bath. - The room HVAC made funny clicking noises & a few times I thought someone was trying to access my room. Would I recommend this hotel? Maybe for a few nights but beyond that I will have to say “no”. It is too far from city centre for a tourist. -beware of pick pocket, they did it 2 time on the same day with me at El rastro (crowdy) and in the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff,super overnight layover in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Omri L
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight twice at the Holiday Inn Madrid on the way to and from a South American Vacation. Rather than join the 12 hr flight to S.America to our 5 hr flight back home we spent the night in Madrid. Our aim therefore was simply to get a good nights rest and a decent meal not to explore Madrid. That said - on our first leg we did take a cab to Plaza Mayor in the historic center - about a 15 min's ride - and taxi's are alsways available at the hotel. Staff was great - allowed us an early check -in with no hassle and assisted us in booking a large taxi to accomodate 3+3 overstuffed suitcases. They have a great breakfast buffet although the same restaurant for dinner was not a great success - better to walk outside 5 minutes in eiither direction there is a wide variety of decent restaurants. The hotel is right opposite the Real Madrid Santiago Benabeu stadium so it might get noisy on game nights. On the other hand if you are there for a game it is perfectly located. The rooms we got both times were roomy and modern. Housekeeping and room service were great. From the airport it is about 30 min's and a 40-50 Euro trip. All in all the Holiday Inn in Madrid fulfilled our purpose perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday inn madrid”
Reviews.Author: manterfield
Reviews.Content: we arrived at hotel good friday 2007, the room was ready early and the reception staff were very welcoming and friendly. any questions and the staff were only too happy to help, the bar was excellent with bar snacks served with every drink the bar man "jesus" was brilliant as was "luis" on reception. the room was clean and spacious and we felt it must have recently undergone refurbishment as it was really modern throughout. had a great time will definitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: Hendes1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights recently and the main puprose of my visit was to watch Real Madrid play football. The hotel was ok. The reception area was light as previously mentioned but not too bad. The staff were helpful and we were able to check in early, they helped us with finding where we wanted to go in Madrid and gave us a map. The room was clean and fairly spacious. It wasnt anything special and had the usual tv, bathroom, expensive mini bar etc. But it was clean and tidy. At the end of the day the room was for sleeping in and the bed was very comfortable and I had a great nights undisturbed sleep. The wireless internet was a little slow and cost 16 euros a day but on the whole suited my needs. The metro stn is very close by and easy to use and navigate and out main reson for being in Madrid - football - meant the hotel was in an ideal location for the stadium a very quick 10 mins walk. I had dinner in the hotel one night at The Big Blue restaurant where the food was very nice - i had paella which was really good. The hotel bar was a little on the expensive side but there are plenty of bars nearby that are cheaper. On the whole I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again. It was a good touring base and had everything we required.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Superbuyer
Reviews.Content: I just spent almost three weeks in this hotel and my stay was a mixture of good with alot of bad. Good Points: The hotel has a good location close to stores, restaurants and the famous Madrid Metro (the best way to get around the city). The room was a nice size (for Europe) and was generally kept clean and I had no problem with any traffic noise. Internet access using the wireless connection was OK but expensive. Not so good: - The staff at the front desk were never friendly & getting answers to simple questions was very frustrating. - The bathroom always had a funny smell, even after cleaning and spending weeks using the room it never smelt “clean”. - Using the shower at about 8.00am bordered on dangerous. The cold water pressure would suddenly decrease leaving only hot water coming out the shower head. The hotel has major cold water pressure problems (when multiple guests are using the bathrooms, showers etc). Luckily I left for my office before 7.00am so only experienced this water issue on the weekends. - The room HVAC made funny clicking noises & a few times I thought someone was trying to access my room. - The restaurant at night was good but the breakfast was complete garbage. Plus the cost was 20 Euro. - Noise from the corridor and adjacent rooms was annoying until about 10.00pm. - Forget about using your calling card to phone the USA. The hotel blocks access. Would I recommend this hotel? Maybe for a few nights but beyond that I will have to say “no”. On future trips to Madrid I will stay at the Silken Puerta Castilla Hotel that other team members have stayed at and has much better reviews (it is also only a few blocks away, so it also has a good location).

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the duff reviews, this is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: orange_sq
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Holiday Inn Madrid for a family pre Christmas weekend break. I booked the hotel a while ago, then seriously considered cancelling after ready some very poor reviews on this website - which I am now glad I ignored. The Hotel is in a good location, situated a 5 min walk from the Santiago Bernabau metro station. The metro in Madrid is superb - efficient, clean and cheap (1 euro fare from madrid airport). The nearby metro station is also great for getting into the town centre (Sol station). This is about 15 mins away and again only 1 euro. If you prefer a taxi the cost is about 6 euros and the route takes you past some interesting sights. Going back to the Hotel, the staff proved to be very helpful and friendly. It was really nice to be welcomed in the room with a complementary bottle of Rioja and fruit basket. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the hotel had a nice atmosphere, particularly the ground floor bar.
