I must assume that the previous reviewers visited pre refurb as it is hard to fault this Hotel as a 3/4 star city centre hotel. For the summer there is a roof top pool, this is closed from September, but you still have access to a really nice spa on the 9th floor with sauna's, gym equipment and a hot tub. The breakfast in the hotel is fantastic. For 20 euros per room you get a huge selection of fruit, pastries, cooked food, deli items, fresh pancakes the list goes on. Madrid itself is a fantastic city. At Christmas time the place is awash with beautiful lights and celebrations. There is plenty to do for a weekend break, although beware the long queues to see the palace. With our Hotel located next door to the Santiago Bernabau, we took in a tour of the football stadium, with the added bonus of seeing David Beckham and his team mates leaving on the coach for a game!!! On the Saturday evening, we dined in the football stadium restuarant overlooking the pitch, a quality restaurant, with reasonable prices providing a unique location. The hotel is also situated close to a shopping centre with a huge and very good department store (El Corte Ingles). To sum up, go enjoy Madrid for a super weekend break. For a good quality Hotel in a good location stay at the Holiday Inn (and ignore the negative reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Make this hotel your very last choice”
Reviews.Author: Bunkerbuster
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at this hotel for a 1 night business trip earlier this month (October 2006). The hotel has doubtless seen better days. The elevators have recently been refurbished but the lighting in the lobby could illuminate an entire football stadium. My room was smelly and without going into grim detail, there was far too much evidence of its previous occupants for my liking. The staff were so laid back they were practcally horizontal and had a casual approcah to their duties, to say the very least. To take one example: the fire alarm went off at 1am local time. This was not particularly loud for a fire alarm but sounded on all floors, as I noted as I headed down the fire escape on the outside of the building. I has been in my room talking with my partner, so we heard the alarm go off clearly enough, but some of my colleagues in other rooms who were asleep did not hear the alarm go off and slept right through it. This makes this hotel a potential death trap. When the alarm was eventually silenced, the night manager seemed to think the whole event was faintly amusing, and just shrugged his shoulders when I asked what the problem was. It occurred to me that this may be a regular occurrence. I will never, ever, darken the doorway of this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel; decent location”
Reviews.Author: Kris02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Madrid for 3 nights during first week of March. Standard Holiday Inn room, but there were two double beds in the room as opposed to the two twin beds you often find in Europe; this arrangement made it much easier to accomodate two children and two adults. Room was very clean and there was a nice basket of fresh fruit and bottle of wine waiting for us when we arrived. Bathroom was a good size with a tub/shower combo. The staff was very friendly and helpful and everyone spoke excellent English. The location is probably best suited for business travelers, as it is a few miles outside of the main tourist district. The hotel is located very close to a subway stop, however, so access to Plaza del Sol, Prado Museum, etc. was quite easy. Hotel was located in an area close to many restaurants, stores and a mall. There is also a restaurant in the hotel at which we had a fairly good dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the Map but readily accessible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Neuvo Metro station is just round the corner with Airport check in facilities. The Metro station is also linked to Charmantin train station. The surrounding area is also full of eateries and shopping. Don't get too worried that it is not shown on the map of Madrid, it costs less than 10 euros to flag a cab to Sol. Takes around 15mins to get to Sol on Metro. The hotel is old and housekeeping is not up to standard sometimes with towel missing or cups misplaced though.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: BertieUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the bank holiday week-end, after reading previous reviews did consider changing the hotel, i am glad we did not. The staff were very polite and helpful, the room quite spacious and not noisy. Breakfast was very good lots of choice. Pool on roof-top, gym facilities if you felt energetic. Overall not a bad place to stay about 3km from city which we did walk one day, stopping along the way at numerous bars. You know you will receive a reasonable standard at a holiday inn as they are pretty much all the same. I am fussy and could not fault the hotel, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Overpriced and over-rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old building and needs a serious renovation both outside and in. Rooms are very dark due to the very small windows, and the beds are not very comfortable. The location of the hotel is very unpractical for tourists as the hotel is located very far from the historic city center. What made the matters worse is the staff at the check-in counter. The manager on duty refused to give us the two bedded room we had requested prior to coming to the hotel. The wireless internet service works poorly as the signal is apparently not strong enough to cover the rooms. I reported the problem to the manager and yet no solution or refund was offered. This hotel is obviously not in the business of satisfying customers. You can do better than this hotel, and nearer the historic center for similar prices. I do recommend that you avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May 2005 on a business trip due to my normal hotel being fully booked. Paid €170 + tax + €20 parking. Breakfast was not included. Hotel is really showing its age, a very 1970's style reception area. Bedroom was very average, nothing bad, but not what you would expect for the money. Getting wireless internet (€10 for 24h) access was very unreliable in the room, despite showing good signal, and never actually got it to work. To make matters worse, there were no outside lines available on the telephone for a number of hours, which meant that dial up to the office was not possible. I would not recommend staying here as there are so many better ones in Madrid for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, staff and amenities”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at this hotel and were very disapointed by the location, rooms, staff and amenities. The rooms are small and in need of renovation. The window is very small and does not let in enough light. We could also hear everything going on in our neighbors bathroom. The location of the hotel is not convenient at all for tourists because it is too far from the historic center. The wireless internet access throughout the hotel is overpriced and does not work well. The signal is too weak and I had to use my laptop by the entrance door of my room to get an intermitent and poor signal. The front desk staff refused to take responsibility for the problem and did not offer a solution or a refund. The check-in staff clearly did not make us feel welcome, refusing to honor our request for a room with two beds, putting us instead in a room with a sofa bed which was very uncomfortable, saying that the hotel was fully booked. Speaking to another employee, we later found out that this was not true and that there was in fact double rooms available and moved in one for the 2nd and 3rd days. I believe you can do much better than this hotel for same or lower prices. While in Madrid beware of pickpockets who operate around attractions and even inside of churches.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but shop around”
Reviews.Author: ParisExpat
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel as Holiday Inns go, and I generally agree with comments made by the previous reviewers. However, I would make one point regarding location. While there are some bars and restaurants and plenty of shops in the area, the hotel is situated north of the city centre (Metro Bernabau - the hotel is by the Real Madrid stadium), and is a very long walk from the Old Town and attractions such as the Royal Palace and the Prado. You'll probably find yourself using the metro and taxis quite a lot (don't bother with the bus - it takes ages!). I used this hotel for a business trip, before moving to a more downtown hotel (the Villa Real) for the weekend - same price, same standard, more charm and perfect location. There is nothing wrong with the Holiday Inn, but I would advise travellers that you can find the same or better downtown for the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: aroseinphilly
Reviews.Content: We just got home on 9/26/04 from a 10 day Globus tour of Spain which used the Holiday Inn/Plaza Carlos as our Madrid location. This is a good hotel, situated one block off the beautiful Castellanos Blvd., near the Hard Rock Cafe and all the lovely sidewalk cafes, lovely buildings, very walkable. The residential neighborhood on the other side of the hotel has a host of good restaurants - remember, everything closed from 2:00 - well after 6:00 PM!!! Dining is later than at home, lunch hard to get unless you're in the restaurant before 2:00 PM, so plan accordingly. Using Priority Club, we upgraded to a higher floor/larger room at no charge. Staff very accommodating - one young lady recommended a lovely paella restaurant in town, near Prada, called Paella Real, which we enjoyed - great food and white sangria. Excellent breakfast buffet. We'd return. Also highly recommend Globus Tours!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the front desk and other staff members too be very polite and professional. All additonal requests were answered in a very short time. The beakfast is superb. The only problem being to chose what to eat from the huge variety! There goes my diet. The Gymnasium with exercise equipment, sauna, is a great place to end a long work day, and then relax in the whirlpool. The only problem I found is if a neighbour plays his TV a bit loud, you can hear it. I strongly recommend this hotel.
